title: How to Fry a Tilapia Fish Fillet

steps.headline: Pat dry the tilapia with a paper towel.
steps.description: This, of course, is after you've rinsed it under cold water.

steps.headline: Place flour, salt, pepper and garlic powder in a bag.
steps.description: Mix it up thoroughly to distribute the flavors. If you have more than one fillet, adjust the recipe as necessary.

steps.headline: Add fish and shake to coat.
steps.description: Once it's adequately covered, shake off any excess.

steps.headline: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat until hot.
steps.description: You may use other oils, but olive oil is tasty and one of the healthier oils.

steps.headline: Add floured fillets to the skillet.
steps.description: Pan fry for two minutes on each side or until cooked through.

steps.headline: Remove and place on a paper towel to absorb oil.
steps.description: It'll be ready by the time you grab plates and silverware.

steps.headline: Serve hot with side dishes and tartar or hot pepper sauce.
Heat the oil in a 3 or 4-quart pan to at least 375° F (190°C).
steps.description: Just a couple of drops of water flipped off your hand will really crackle when the oil has reached this heat level.

steps.headline: Roll the dry and thawed fish in the flour.
steps.description: Shake off the excess flour and let the fillets sit on a rack or on wax paper for 5-10 minutes. Roll the fillets in the flour a second time. As before, shake off the excess flour. Now they're ready for the pan!

steps.headline: Deep fry those bad boys.
steps.description: No more than 2 at a time, however. Frying more than 2 fillets at once drives down the oil temperature which will make the fish and coating soggy. Turn once in the pan after a minute or so and remove when golden brown. They should be done in under 4 minutes; white and flaky inside at the thickest section of the fillet. Do not overcook!

steps.headline: Drain each fillet on paper towels for a few seconds and serve immediately.
steps.description: Garnish with sauces and sides for taste and presentation.
